00:00:04:120000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:04:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:04:120000.Dialogue: I must say, Penny, this is great fun.

00:00:07:060000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:07:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:08:190000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:08:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:08:190000.Dialogue: Until I met you and Bernadette, my trips to the bathroom had been entirely focused on elimination. Now they have a delightful social aspect.

00:00:17:170000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:17:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:17:170000.Dialogue: Amy, you must've been in the bathroom with other women before.

00:00:20:190000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:20:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:20:190000.Dialogue: Of course I have. But they were strangers and seemed off-put when I engaged in friendly stall-to-stall chit-chat.

00:00:29:200000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:29:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:29:200000.Dialogue: Some women don't like to get chummy when their panties are down.

00:00:34:030000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:34:030000.Speaker: Amy

00:00:37:060000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:37:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:38:120000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:38:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:38:120000.Dialogue: The reason I ask is that many people experience bladder shyness; the inability to pass uri...

00:00:43:080000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:43:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:43:080000.Dialogue: Yeah, I said I'm fine. Stop talking to me.

00:00:45:120000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:45:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:45:120000.Dialogue: She always this crabby when she urinates?

00:00:47:220000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:47:220000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:00:50:020000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:50:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:53:030000.Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
00:00:53:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:53:030000.Dialogue: And I'll be right by your side.

00:00:57:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:57:210000.Dialogue: Did I tell you Priya invited me and Howard to have dinner with her and Leonard?

00:01:03:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:03:040000.Dialogue: No, it's not. It's a strategic maneuver. Leonard's new girlfriend is testing Bernadette's loyalty to you and the group. That bitch is crafty.

00:01:22:120000.Speaker: Bernadettef
00:01:22:120000.Dialogue: Well, what makes me the weakest member?

00:01:25:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:25:190000.Dialogue: Your trusting nature coupled with your teeny-tiny body. You wouldn't last a minute on the Serengeti.

00:01:32:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:32:140000.Dialogue: Okay, Amy, you're being silly. I'm not concerned about who hangs out with who. And I certainly don't have a problem with Leonard's new girlfriend who wears way too much makeup.

00:01:42:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:42:080000.Dialogue: Ooh, these are cute. Of course if I buy them, I'll have to rent my womb out to a gay couple.

00:01:51:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:51:140000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter. I'm going to tell her we can't make it.

00:01:53:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:53:180000.Dialogue: Oh, no. You have to go.

00:01:55:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:55:140000.Dialogue: I don't understand. I thought I was a teeny-tiny wildebeest.

00:01:59:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:59:160000.Dialogue: You are-- with hair that smells like strawberries. And we're going to use that to our advantage.

00:02:05:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:05:040000.Dialogue: Wait. What are you talking about?

00:02:06:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:06:130000.Dialogue: By accepting the invitation, Bernadette becomes a double agent inside the enemy camp. She could ferret out Priya's tactics, identify her weaknesses and feed her false information, such as: Leonard's no stranger to back-alley cockfights.

00:02:20:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:20:060000.Dialogue: I don't know. I'm not a very good liar. They kind of whup that out of you in Catholic school.

00:02:25:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:25:140000.Dialogue: Don't worry. I'll teach you. I did two years of Cub Scouts before they found out I was a girl.

00:02:33:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:33:040000.Dialogue: Okay, I don't know you people. I'm just an innocent woman wondering if this shoe store will take my Texaco card.

00:02:41:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:41:010000.Dialogue: How do you feel about concealing a recording device in the cleavage of your ample bosom?

00:02:46:080000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:46:080000.Dialogue: I don't want anything in my ample bosom.

00:02:49:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:49:210000.Dialogue: Come on, Strawberries. Take one for the team.

00:03:32:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:32:050000.Dialogue: Uh, do you know how I solved the balanced center combat-area problem? Five words: transitional quadrilateral to triangular tessellation.

00:03:47:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:140000.Dialogue: But wait, there's more. I also invented two new chess pieces. The serpent... and the old woman.

00:03:57:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:57:120000.Dialogue: Okay, now I have to ask. What do they do?

00:03:59:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:59:220000.Dialogue: When the serpent slithers to an opposing player's piece, that piece is considered poisoned and will die after two more moves.

00:04:12:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:12:010000.Dialogue: Unless... it gets to the old woman in time, in which case she sucks out the poison, turning her into the Grand Empress:

00:04:24:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:24:210000.Dialogue: a piece combining the power of the knight, queen and serpent.

00:04:35:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:35:220000.Dialogue: Okay, well, I look forward to playing with you.

00:04:40:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:40:040000.Dialogue: And a third person. It's three-person chess. I must say, ever since you started having regular intercourse, your mind has lost its keen edge.

00:04:54:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:54:120000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but Einstein had a pretty busy sex life.

00:04:57:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:57:110000.Dialogue: Yes, and he never unified gravity with the other forces. If he hadn't been such a hound dog, we'd all have time machines.

00:05:44:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:44:120000.Dialogue: Please, Leonard, don't leer, you have a girlfriend.

00:05:52:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:52:160000.Dialogue: I heard it at the mall, when I was shopping with my girlfriends, cause, you know, that's kind of my life now.

00:05:58:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:58:230000.Dialogue: Have a good night. Try not to ogle my caboose as I walk away.

00:06:16:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:16:120000.Dialogue: The lonely guy and the two happy couples? I'd rather get a prostate exam from a leper who walks away with nine fingers.

00:06:24:090000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:24:090000.Dialogue: Oh, would you please stop feeling sorry for yourself?

00:06:28:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:28:030000.Dialogue: I have to feel sorry for myself. I'm the only one who cares. Just like I'm the only one who'll have sex with me.

00:06:34:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:34:060000.Dialogue: Really? In front of your sister?

00:06:37:040000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:37:040000.Dialogue: We shared a room growing up. This is not news to me.

00:06:41:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:41:040000.Dialogue: Excuse me. I'm going to go wander the streets alone. Invisible, unwanted and unloved; a pathetic shadow in a city with no heart. I forgot my windbreaker. It's chilly.

00:06:57:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:57:200000.Dialogue: I don't understand. Is this a way to break in new shoes?

00:07:01:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:01:190000.Dialogue: No. Once these puppies touch the ground they're mine, and I'll have to wear them walking up and down Hollywood Boulevard in order to pay them off.

00:07:14:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:14:050000.Dialogue: Good news: the wildebeest is in the curry.

00:07:19:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:19:030000.Dialogue: Bernadette is with Priya and Leonard. Message received. Commence operation "Priya Wouldn't Wanna Be-ya."

00:07:30:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:30:090000.Dialogue: Hey. Seriously? Didn't you get enough of this cliquey crap in high school?

00:07:34:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:34:170000.Dialogue: I wish. A clique requires friends. - I didn't have any.

00:07:39:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:39:070000.Dialogue: I used to take my lunch down to the maintenance room and eat with the janitor. It was nice until his wife called me a puta and made me stop.

00:07:50:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:50:120000.Dialogue: Hang on. It's the wildebeest. Priya just made a snide comment about your acting career.

00:07:58:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:58:120000.Dialogue: W-What the hell did she say?

00:08:00:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:00:090000.Dialogue: She thinks it's cool you're following your dream, no matter what.

00:08:07:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:07:190000.Dialogue: How do you want to handle it?

00:08:10:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:10:120000.Dialogue: Um, okay. Tell Bernadette to tell Priya that I'm on my way to Prague to shoot a movie with Angelina Jolie.

00:08:17:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:17:200000.Dialogue: Got it. Is it going to be in 3-D?

00:08:22:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:22:090000.Dialogue: What? I don't know. It doesn't matter.

00:08:24:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:24:050000.Dialogue: I'm gonna say 3-D. That'll let her know the studio has faith in it.

00:08:36:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:36:170000.Dialogue: Then the studio must have real faith in it.

00:08:41:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:41:020000.Dialogue: Wonder why she didn't tell me.

00:08:43:060000.Speaker: Priya
00:08:43:060000.Dialogue: Have you been spending time with your ex-girlfriend?

00:08:47:170000.Speaker: Priya
00:08:47:170000.Dialogue: Then why are you surprised she didn't tell you?

00:08:50:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:50:070000.Dialogue: Well, it's not as much "surprised" as you know... uh... the other thing.

00:09:00:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:00:200000.Dialogue: Well, if you... uh... I don't... oh... What's the word I'm looking for?

00:09:09:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:09:090000.Dialogue: I'm not going to help you. This is hilarious.

00:09:28:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:28:100000.Dialogue: Thank you. Befuddled. The word I was looking for was "befuddled."

00:09:41:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:09:41:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:47:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:09:47:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:57:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:09:57:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:04:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:04:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:10:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:10:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:10:030000.Dialogue: Will the two of you excuse me?

00:10:17:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:17:190000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:21:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:21:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:29:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:29:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:29:130000.Dialogue: Come on, Sheldon, open the door.

00:10:32:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:32:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:32:040000.Dialogue: I don't want to hug you.

00:10:35:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:35:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:35:120000.Dialogue: I don't want to hug you, either. I was just feeling blue.

00:10:38:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:38:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:41:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:41:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:41:010000.Dialogue: Well, not so much depressed as lonely.

00:10:43:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:43:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:43:050000.Dialogue: I don't know what color lonely is.

00:10:46:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:46:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:46:040000.Dialogue: - Red is angry; yellow is frightened; green is jealous; and blue is depressed. Perhaps we can assign a color to lonely.

00:10:56:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:10:56:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:56:050000.Dialogue: Nothing rhymes with orange. It's probably lonely.

00:11:01:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:01:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:01:020000.Dialogue: All right. Come in. You look positively orange with loneliness.

00:11:07:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:07:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:07:080000.Dialogue: No, I don't see that catching on at all.

00:11:10:160000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:10:160000.Speaker: Raj

00:11:11:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:11:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:11:210000.Dialogue: I'm working on my three-person chess game.

00:11:13:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:13:180000.Speaker: Raj

00:11:17:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:17:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:17:130000.Dialogue: It's three-person chess. Did you bring a friend?

00:11:22:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:22:070000.Speaker: Raj

00:11:23:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:23:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:23:220000.Dialogue: Then as a mental exercise I invite you to figure out why the two of us can't play three-person chess.

00:11:32:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:32:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:37:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:37:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:37:230000.Dialogue: Social protocol does, however, require me to bring you a hot beverage in your time of need.

00:11:42:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:42:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:11:43:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:43:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:46:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:46:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:46:070000.Dialogue: We're out of tea. I hope you like bouillon.

00:11:49:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:49:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:49:230000.Dialogue: I, uh, I guess you're probably wondering what's got me down.

00:11:53:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:11:53:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:53:220000.Dialogue: Actually, I was wondering if I could add a third new chess piece. How do you think people would feel about Prince Joey-- the king's feeble-minded but well-meaning cousin?

00:12:04:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:04:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:04:230000.Dialogue: I'm going to be 30 years old, and I have no one in my life to love me. I'm such a basket case, I can't even talk to a woman without having alcohol in my body.

00:12:13:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:13:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:13:120000.Dialogue: The fun thing about Prince Joey is every time he moves, there's a one-in-five chance he'll kill himself.

00:12:23:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:23:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:23:050000.Dialogue: Sheldon, listen to me. I have a big decision to make, and I'm scared.

00:12:27:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:27:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:30:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:30:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:30:180000.Dialogue: A friend at the School of Pharmacology gave me these new pills they're testing. He says it's the next big thing for social anxiety disorder.

00:12:36:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:36:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:39:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:39:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:39:020000.Dialogue: I'm not sure. Some sort of beta-blocker attached to a molecule extracted from the urine of cows.

00:12:45:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:45:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:47:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:47:230000.Speaker: Raj

00:12:49:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:49:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:49:040000.Dialogue: It was its own point. Go on.

00:12:51:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:12:51:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:51:200000.Dialogue: I'm a scientist. My ability to think is my bread and butter. I'm afraid if I take this, I might lose that special, unique something that makes me so successful in my field.

00:13:01:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
00:13:01:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:01:130000.Dialogue: Rajesh, I've had the privilege of working alongside you for many years. My recommendation is that you gobble these up like Tic Tacs.

00:13:17:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:17:230000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm still trying to work this out. How did Penny meet an astronaut?

00:13:24:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:24:010000.Dialogue: I don't know. The regular way people meet astronauts.

00:13:28:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:28:090000.Dialogue: Most of those guys live in Texas.

00:13:36:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:36:060000.Dialogue: Leonard lives here. Priya's from India. People meet, Howard. God!

00:13:43:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:43:020000.Dialogue: You've met lots of astronauts, and I've never grilled you about that. I'd thank you to extend me the same courtesy.

00:13:51:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:51:000000.Dialogue: I'm not grilling you; I was just curious.

00:13:53:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:53:200000.Dialogue: I still can't get over the fact that she got a big movie part. Not that I care what my ex-girlfriend's up to, 'cause I don't.

00:14:02:080000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:02:080000.Dialogue: Maybe that's where she met the astronaut, all right?

00:14:05:180000.Speaker: Priya
00:14:05:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. What would an astronaut be doing working on a movie?

00:14:12:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:12:070000.Dialogue: I thought the movie was about 18th-century Vienna.

00:14:20:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:20:060000.Dialogue: Excuse me, I have to pee. Or is that implausible, as well?!

00:14:28:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:28:230000.Dialogue: It's nice to have another couple to hang with, isn't it?

00:14:34:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:34:070000.Dialogue: All right, guys, you have to go back. I can't afford you. No, don't send us away; we love you.

00:14:43:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:43:010000.Dialogue: I love you, too, but you cost more than my rent. But, Penny, you look so good in us. Damn it, the shoes are right.

00:14:52:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:52:050000.Dialogue: Good golly, Penny, your whimsy is boundless.

00:14:59:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:59:220000.Dialogue: What do you got for me, wildebeest?

00:15:02:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:02:160000.Dialogue: I think they're on to me. The story's starting to fall apart.

00:15:06:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:06:230000.Dialogue: Calm down. Everything's going to be okay. We may have to kill her. Bernadette, I'm putting you on speakerphone. Where are you now?

00:15:16:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:16:180000.Dialogue: Oh, look at this, another one of our classic bathroom gabfests. What's the problem?

00:15:22:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:22:190000.Dialogue: They're just asking me all sorts of questions I can't answer.

00:15:28:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:28:020000.Dialogue: I suppose I could get them back to talking about Leonard going to India to meet Priya's parents.

00:15:33:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:33:060000.Dialogue: They said something about going there this summer.

00:15:37:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:37:230000.Dialogue: I don't know. I was too busy covering my heinie on Amy's stupid astronaut story!

00:15:45:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:45:180000.Dialogue: You texted me Penny's dating an astronaut.

00:15:48:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:48:070000.Dialogue: I texted "architect." That's amusing. Auto-correct must've changed it.

00:15:56:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:56:210000.Dialogue: All right, look, just forget about the astronaut.

00:15:59:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:59:110000.Dialogue: Architect. Where would you have met an astronaut?

00:16:04:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:04:010000.Dialogue: Look, just find out what's up with this trip to India.

00:16:06:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:06:130000.Dialogue: I don't want to do this anymore!

00:16:16:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:16:200000.Dialogue: Thank you for coming with me, Sheldon. You're a good friend.

00:16:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:19:230000.Dialogue: I'm glad you think so. That's what I strive to emulate.

00:16:23:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:23:160000.Dialogue: Okay, let's see if this drug works.

00:16:43:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:43:140000.Dialogue: Forgive me for staring, but you're very beautiful.

00:16:53:160000.Speaker: Woman
00:16:53:160000.Dialogue: Thank you. That's a great accent. Where are you from?

00:16:58:140000.Speaker: Woman
00:16:58:140000.Dialogue: Oh, cool. I've always wanted to go there.

00:17:00:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:00:070000.Dialogue: It's a beautiful country. You'd love it. May I join you?

00:17:06:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:06:140000.Dialogue: My name is Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali, and this is my friend Dr. Sheldon Cooper.

00:17:10:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:10:180000.Dialogue: There's no need to interact with me. I'm just here to observe.

00:17:17:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:17:100000.Dialogue: We're scientists. We observe everything. Here, go buy yourself a scone.

00:17:26:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:26:220000.Dialogue: Oh, derived from the word "angel." Appropriate.

00:17:32:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:32:100000.Dialogue: I'd like to buy a scone.

00:17:34:080000.Speaker: Server
00:17:34:080000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry, we're out. We have muffins.

00:17:36:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:36:190000.Dialogue: They sound delicious, but this money is earmarked for scones.

00:17:43:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:43:040000.Dialogue: Oh, just getting comfortable. So how long have you lived in Los Angeles?

00:17:51:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:51:100000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm talking to someone. You're being rude. I'll bet you're an actress. If not, you should be. You have a very expressive face.

00:18:00:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:00:140000.Dialogue: Wait, where are you going? We were doing so well. She never even got to see my penis.

00:18:18:090000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:18:090000.Speaker: Priya

00:18:20:160000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:20:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:22:040000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:22:040000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:18:25:130000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:25:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:25:130000.Dialogue: Nice to see that the gals are getting along.

00:18:28:140000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:28:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:28:140000.Dialogue: Gals? Who are you, Fred Flintstone?

00:18:34:090000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:34:090000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:34:090000.Dialogue: This trip to India sounds fun.

00:18:36:040000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:36:040000.Speaker: Priya
00:18:36:040000.Dialogue: Yeah, I think it will be.

00:18:37:140000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:37:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:37:140000.Dialogue: Are you concerned your parents might not approve of Leonard?

00:18:40:130000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:40:130000.Speaker: Priya

00:18:44:040000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:44:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:44:040000.Dialogue: Well, I wouldn't worry about it. It's not like you guys are getting engaged, right?

00:18:50:020000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:50:020000.Speaker: Priya
00:18:50:020000.Dialogue: Oh, God, no. We're not there yet.

00:18:53:030000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:53:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:53:030000.Dialogue: Not engaged. Very interesting. I have to tinkle.

00:18:57:080000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:57:080000.Speaker: Priya
00:18:57:080000.Dialogue: You've been in there a lot tonight. Are you okay?

00:18:59:060000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:18:59:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:59:060000.Dialogue: Yes. Are you writing a book?

00:19:02:190000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:19:02:190000.Speaker: Priya

00:19:04:220000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:19:04:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:04:220000.Dialogue: I'm not upset. Maybe you're upset.

00:19:07:140000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:19:07:140000.Speaker: Priya

00:19:15:040000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:19:15:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:15:040000.Dialogue: I can't do this anymore! I'm a good girl! I went to Catholic school!

00:19:23:030000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:19:23:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:23:030000.Dialogue: Okay, well, it's getting late. This was terrific. You win. Bernie?

00:19:34:230000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
00:19:34:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:34:230000.Dialogue: I think the word you're looking for is "befuddled."

00:19:44:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:19:44:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:44:210000.Dialogue: My catapult flings my bishop to Howard's Queen's Gorilla two.

00:19:55:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:19:55:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:55:110000.Dialogue: Nice. Okay, rook to transporter pad. And he comes out at... ...Leonard's Queen's Bishop five-and-a-third. Check on Leonard.

00:20:12:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:20:12:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:12:070000.Dialogue: Hang on. When is my pawn allowed to use the golf cart?

00:20:19:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:20:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:19:230000.Dialogue: When it's done charging. Or you land on the time machine. Obviously.

00:20:26:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:20:26:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:26:020000.Dialogue: Oh, oh... Beekeeper to King 12. I capture your pope and release the swarm.

00:20:38:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:20:38:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:41:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:20:41:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:41:040000.Dialogue: I knew I should've given my pope the jet pack.

00:20:45:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
00:20:45:150000.Speaker: Raj
